text:
“Very much?” Zametov asked.

“Very much!” Raskolnikov replied, leaning closer. 

He whispered, “I should have taken the money and jewels. I’d find a deserted place. A heavy stone would hide them well. I’d leave it for years. They could search; there’d be no trace.”

“You are a madman,” Zametov said, backing away. 

Raskolnikov’s eyes glittered. His face turned pale. 

He leaned in, lips moving silently. The word trembled on his lips, ready to break free.

**PAGE SUMMARY:** Raskolnikov contemplates a meticulous plan to conceal stolen money and jewels, revealing his inner turmoil and desperation.
